snippet: In the first election of local leaders since the shooting of an unarmed black teenager, Ferguson, Mo., will vote to fill three City Council seats, and the ballot has an unprecedented number of African Americans.
abstract: Ferguson, Mo, will hold its first City Council election since shooting of Michael Brown, and ballot features unprecedented number of African Americans; election will test whether anger and calls for reform will translate into improvement of historically abysmal voter turnout and a new direction at ballot box; new Council members will face enormous pressure and scrutiny during three-year terms.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and JOHN ELIGON

lead_paragraph: In the first election of local leaders since the shooting of an unarmed black teenager, Ferguson, Mo., will vote to fill three City Council seats, and the ballot has an unprecedented number of African Americans.

headline.main: City Council Races Offer Change in Ferguson After Months of Upheaval
headline.print_headline: Council Races Offer Change in Ferguson
